These inferences come back to us in the form of targeted advertising: sometimes uncanny (when an ad for shoes pops up right after you talked about needing a new pair), sometimes clumsy (when you search for a barbecue and ads for it follow you around the web for days), and always creepy.
Deeply personal information can be inferred from our every click, whether it's a "like" or a purchase or simply the act of hovering over a link or lingering on a page.
